meanings.definition: The act of falling or flowing in.
meanings.sent1: The infalls of rain filled the river with water.
meanings.sent2: The infalls of leaves in autumn create a beautiful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The infalls of giggles from the children brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: The infalls of sunlight through the window warmed up the chilly room.
meanings.sent5: The infalls of snow covered the town in a blanket of white.

meanings.definition: A sudden or unexpected influx or arrival.
meanings.sent1: The infalls of visitors caught the museum staff by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The infalls of orders during the holiday season kept the workers busy.
meanings.sent3: The infalls of compliments made her blush with happiness.
meanings.sent4: The infalls of emails flooded his inbox after the announcement.
meanings.sent5: The infalls of customers at the store caused a line at the checkout.
